commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If8e5839dee564f975804a2a661180e47c5107caf

commit_message:
Drop dep on python-masakariclient

There is no logic in python-masakariclient that masakari-dashboard
requires. It is safe to drop. The check for supported API versions
was irrelevant already as it depends directly on OpenStack SDK.

Change-Id: I97c6db49f1a4dbd36f7003299938a05994e37cb6

commit_message:
Add option to set listener timeouts for lb created by Kuryr

The timeout-client-data and timeout-member-data configurations
for Octavia listeners default to 50 seconds for load balancers
created by Kuryr. This patch allows the creation and modification
of load balancers handled by Kuryr with different timeouts values.

Implements: blueprint configure-lb-listeners-timeout
Change-Id: I99016001c2263023d1fa2637d7b5aeb23b3b2d9d

commit_message:
Do not permit IPA standalone to be enabled by conf

IPA standalone mode is a developer-only option, and if enabled
accidentally on a production agent could cause undesired behavior.

Developers who need this behavior should build a purpose-built agent,
with standalone hardcoded to True in cmd/agent.py.

Change-Id: Icc67dbe15acbbf6fee886f274d2169a0769a5053

commit_message:
Add missing boilerplate

.gitreview, .zuul.yaml, .jujuignore, copyright
Also align tox.ini with charm-ceph-iscsi.

Also temporarily disable Zaza tests as we don't have
the necessary NetApp ONTAP cluster deployed yet in
order to run them.

Change-Id: Ic12afbccfe8a3bf15e1dbb42ed093164d9aeaed6

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7a9cfbd32bd720befb4f26a75e82100b6921afaf

commit_message:
Follow up NetApp ONTAP FlexGroup feature

It is a follow up to the patch [1], providing the fixes:

1. Check the ONTAP storage version for the FlexGroup feature.
The feature is only accepted whether the ONTAP is 9.8 or greater.

2. Remove multiattach support for flexgroup pools.

3. Start bumping the driver version with its documentation.

4. Update the flexgroup release notes.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/776713

Change-Id: I0636b6530a79f8ca86db52f87273ec822c3cb406

commit_message:
Bump max Ansible version to 2.10

Molecule also needs to be bumped to support Ansible 2.10
lint: section changed in Molecule 3.x - adapted.
molecule-docker added do test-reqs because it code has moved to it from
molecule core
pytest-testinfra and pytest-molecule needed for testinfra tests to work

[1]: https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/issues/2872

Change-Id: I0299f5126ebd080f3912a76294b0013abe7747a0

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per our PTG resolution [1] and general OpenStack resolution [2], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/018445.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I58807c27fd20c7269019e26e8b507744d35325f3
(cherry picked from commit 8e9323d236a26a6514cdc5a60ac220a50a81abc7)

commit_message:
Debian: install newer firmware for qemu/aarch64

Nova looks into /usr/share/qemu/firmware/ directory. We need 2020.05
version of firmware package for it.

ERROR: nova.exception.InternalError: Failed to locate firmware descriptor files
Change-Id: I546bcf910e886eb75ece62f6be382fe1187efb32

commit_message:
Add Ghanshyam nomination as chair

I would like to nominate myself as chair of the
Technical Committee for Xena cycle.

I am serving as TC since Stein cycle, which is 3rd year. I am
trying my best to be more active in TC and leading the things
in various form, for example, community-wide goal, TC discussion
or any reach out to project teams. As TC chair, I would like to
continue the same and try to improve the TC interaction with
rest of the community.

Having my majority of the job time for upstream activities will help
me to fulfil all the TC chair duties[1] and to drive the new initiative
from TC or community.

Thanks for considering my nomination.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/CHAIR.rst

Change-Id: I856b360111339e25c50fbaed6b00a6c58472dc92

commit_message:
Remove extra/vif_port_id

Removes API translation layer into port/portgroup internal_info
Removes internal logic to support use of VIFs stored in the extra
field, which effectively means all vif binding must now utilize
vif attachment and detachment.

This is a change that we likely should have pushed forward a couple
years back, but I didn't want to break compatability with very old
of ironic or standalone users which were deploying instances using
very old instructions. That being said, it is necessary to remove
the legacy vif support so new access controls can properly wrap
vif API endpoints.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin/+/769204
Change-Id: I588b3a64475656542389ff83786189e2dc16d35c

subject: Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 05:38:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.rst'], 'message': "Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)
(cherry picked from commit 276b8db5afd945bfc56ccfadd25bcce1b6df9cb7)
(cherry picked from commit a968289b1f89b52d7396b66294f768c732583849)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)
(cherry picked from commit 276b8db5afd945bfc56ccfadd25bcce1b6df9cb7)
(cherry picked from commit a968289b1f89b52d7396b66294f768c732583849)

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

commit_message:
Proposing Wallaby RC1 for blazar

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 6.0.0..d3f77fd
d3f77fd Add usage enforcement framework
77cf902 Change dashes to underscore in setup.cfg
d14668b Drop unused sqlalchemy-migrate requirement
3f1c1ed [goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file
7d131c9 Re-use rpc transport
37bee67 Make lower-constraints job non-voting
b1841dc Fix use of legacy Alembic API
e81bbc7 remove unicode from code
ae43ea3 Remove six
963097e Add doc/requirements
4f642c8 Fix lower-constraints job
a1ecf0d Remove misplaced return statement
ccf1727 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
0847f7e Remove unused DB utility functions
368403e Remove the unused coding style modules
4935706 bump py37 to py38 in tox.ini
184dbcc Reuse the docs deps to benefit from constraints
38189e1 Remove Babel requirement
021d1d7 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
d8ddf42 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id9fa9981a50a74ceb5fa818a71f9790f4a1c7097

commit_message:
Disable libvirtd.service before starting sockets

This change makes sure that libvirtd.service is stopped when starting
libvirtd-tcp/tls.socket, because these socket fails to start if
libvirtd.service is already running.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759595/
Change-Id: I4a670aa77f0f0406a96db07877354b5067ddf1da
(cherry picked from commit 451f5203214ede6738cce5f2abeeae93a7f8ae36)
(cherry picked from commit 675474d0e55e1c7504ecfdcba65723aea4656142)
(cherry picked from commit 736a330cd2084fae4ac3199e5cf6b693f6fedd3a)

revisions:

Core reviewers for neutron-lib stable branches were in
neutron-lib-stable-maint group. But this group i now empty and based on
current state of neutron and neutron-lib projects, I think that we can
replace that neutron-lib-stable-maint group with neutron-stable-maint

Change-Id: Ied0b9820cdf86505380f2392a53ffeb130d0421f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add neutron stable cores +2 powers in stable neutron-lib branches

Core reviewers for neutron-lib stable branches were in
neutron-lib-stable-maint group. But this group i now empty and based on
current state of neutron and neutron-lib projects, I think that we can
replace that neutron-lib-stable-maint group with neutron-stable-maint
group so neutron stable cores will have same permissions in the
neutron-lib's stable branches as well.

Change-Id: Ied0b9820cdf86505380f2392a53ffeb130d0421f

commit_message:
Add log for cron script fernet-rotate.sh

This change also changes the out-format of rsync to put a timestamp,
file name, last-modified time of the file and bytes transferred

Change-Id: I98305858c4fcb428997d5f85780fe644e07fbed3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-01 07:37:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactoring - add pool of ports to be used in tests

All tests are running in parallel on the same LB created by setup.
As the result we had to manage ports used to create listeners
in manuall manner, in order to avoid conflicts, by increasing
port number on each new test.
This patch adds pool of ports as a class attribute and each test
pulls the unique port using Python's "pop" from list function.

Change-Id: Ib11ea79710615e671908d31daa6785ad6e13b8e9

Change-Id: Ib11ea79710615e671908d31daa6785ad6e13b8e9
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2021-01-28 08:50:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactoring - add pool of ports to be used in tests

In order to prevent "port conflicts" while parallel execution of the tests,
we had to increase the port number while adding new tests, by increasing the
last used port (+1).
This patch adds "pool of ports" as a class attribute.
Each test must pull the unique port number from that pool of ports,
for example:
test_port = self.pool_of_ports['http_range'].pop(0)
will pull the unique HTTP port.

commit_message:
Refactoring - add pool of ports to be used in tests

In order to prevent "port conflicts" while parallel execution of the tests,
we had to increase the port number while adding new tests, by increasing the
last used port (+1).
This patch adds "pool of ports" as a class attribute.
Each test must pull the unique port number from that pool of ports,
for example:
test_port = self.pool_of_ports['http_range'].pop(0)
will pull the unique HTTP port.

Change-Id: Ib11ea79710615e671908d31daa6785ad6e13b8e9

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

commit_message:
Proposing Wallaby RC1 for kuryr-kubernetes

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.0.0..5ccf238e
5ccf238e Fixing bug, cannot delete pools when members are empty
3807f8eb Adds SCTPConnectivity tests to e2e network policy tests

e5453242 Speed pools population by relying on KuryrPort CR
99058014 Fix number of ports requested on pool pre-population
2611dc3b Make parse_network_policy_rules private.
1d8afc72 Update documentation for svc and ep annotation to KuryrLoadBalancer
229a990b Get trunks more diligently
1473cfc3 Ignore headless services in NP code
65711ea9 Run k8s e2e tests for network policy
28b315ec Bump kubernetes verrion to 1.19.1.
e95ed536 Add OpenShiftNodesSubnets driver and MachineHandler

commit_message:
Make baremetal --debug actually work

The --debug option exists but does nothing. Wire in openstacksdk logging
and make sure ironicclient can log as well.

Change-Id: I136503f546be2ecbd3203ee07597df59a40a594e
(cherry picked from commit 4a22f29f1e439d20b66a5f20de1d501b11a4d385)

commit_message:
Make baremetal --debug actually work

The --debug option exists but does nothing. Wire in openstacksdk logging
and make sure ironicclient can log as well.

Change-Id: I136503f546be2ecbd3203ee07597df59a40a594e
(cherry picked from commit 4a22f29f1e439d20b66a5f20de1d501b11a4d385)

subject: Add a configurable URL base to staticweb
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-19 23:37:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a configurable URL base to staticweb

This came to light because someone ran Tempest against a standard
installation of RDO, which helpfuly terminates SSL for Swift in
a pre-configured load-balancer. In such a case, staticweb has no
way to know what scheme to use and guesses wrong, causing Tempest
to fail.

Related upstream bug:
 https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1537071

Change-Id: Ie15cf2aff4f7e6bcf68b67ae733c77bb9353587a
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2016-10-04 03:09:03.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/staticweb.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_staticweb.py'], 'message': 'Add a configurable URL base to staticweb

This came to light because someone ran Tempest against a standard
installation of RDO, which helpfuly terminates SSL for Swift in
a pre-configured load-balancer. In such a case, staticweb has no
way to know what scheme to use and guesses wrong, causing Tempest
to fail.

Related upstream bug:
 https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1537071

Change-Id: Ie15cf2aff4f7e6bcf68b67ae733c77bb9353587a
Closes-Bug: 1572011
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add a configurable URL base to staticweb

This came to light because someone ran Tempest against a standard
installation of RDO, which helpfuly terminates SSL for Swift in
a pre-configured load-balancer. In such a case, staticweb has no
way to know what scheme to use and guesses wrong, causing Tempest
to fail.

Related upstream bug:
 https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1537071

Change-Id: Ie15cf2aff4f7e6bcf68b67ae733c77bb9353587a
Closes-Bug: 1572011

commit_message:

Ironic base puppet step config is ignored by API and conductor
services. Include it to apply the missed puppet configurations
for the base class.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change new policy rules for availability zones API

It was previously set that both SYSTEM and PROJECT READER could get
access to it. But this resource don't have project_id so PROJECT_READER
should be removed from that rule and only SYSTEM scope users should be
able to get it.

This patch also adds UT for policies for that API.

Related-blueprint: bp/secure-rbac-roles
Change-Id: Idfaf36c3dd003c9c5c1ce3f9ee889ba54643e831

subject: Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 11:18:41.000000000', 'files': ['conf.d/libvirt.yaml.example', 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py'], 'message': "Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
(cherry picked from commit 085f64578f40152273138898a0dc4566d327dc8f)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
(cherry picked from commit 085f64578f40152273138898a0dc4566d327dc8f)

docs: Remove duplicated PCI passthrough extra spec info

remove the sections for various extra specs from the 'user/flavors'
guide:

- hw:pci_numa_affinity_policy

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support serial mode to upgrade ceph

When the kolla version changes, such as adding new features or ceph
version upgrades, users need to upgrade the old version of the image
to the new version.
This commit provides a safer way to upgrade, serial mode, it has the
following features:

1. Only upgrade one ceph component on one node at a time.
2. Perform ceph status detection before upgrading each component,
upgrade only in HEALTH_OK state.
3.When upgrading osd, noout and norebalance are set before the upgrade
to prevent data rebalancing. The osd upgrade on the same node is also
run in sequence.

Please refer to the "Deploy ceph individually and upgrade securely"
section in the kolla-ansible documentation[0].

[0] kolla-ansible/doc/source/reference/ceph-guide.rst

Change-Id: Ia4cd15d64aef8d05d33b8a76c8d951d424dfe069

commit_message:
docs: Add a real-time guide

This beefy patch closes a long-standing TODO and allows us to move yet
more information out of the flavors guide and into specific documents.
This, combined with existing documentation in place, means we can remove
the sections for various extra specs from the 'user/flavors' guide:

- hw:cpu_realtime            -> doc/source/admin/real-time.rst
- hw:cpu_realtime_mask       -> doc/source/admin/real-time.rst
- hw:emulator_threads_policy -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_policy              -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_thread_policy       -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_sockets             -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_cores               -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_threads             -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_max_sockets         -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_max_cores           -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_max_threads         -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:numa_nodes              -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:numa_cpus.N             -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:numa_mem.N              -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:mem_page_size           -> doc/source/admin/huge-pages.rst

Multiple improvements to the libvirt extra spec docs are included here,
for want of a better place to include them.

Change-Id: I02b044f8246f4a42481bb5f00259842692b29b71
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Use kolla-cli in gate jobs

This work is very much in debug and should be ignored for now.
The idea is that deploy, upgrade, etc will be done with the kolla-cli.
It will likely take many iterations to get this to work.

Depends-On: I4dc1e1ce8d1839e7550479799fb00e2613d979df

Change-Id: I6cd898460aa4bbe68d3f86bc7733d58ac74f392f

When deploying ceph_mon node, it will check cluster interface
and if there has no that interface,kolla-ansible will raise an

commit_message:
Fix ceph_mon check ceph cluster network

When deploying ceph_mon node, it will check cluster interface
and if there has no that interface,kolla-ansible will raise an
error, but this is not necessary for ceph itself.

Reslove by generating different configure task depends on different
ceph roles.

Change-Id: I64e5b3ee9136235070661685e72e4c6fa411cda4
Closes-Bug: #1729589

[{'created': '2019-05-13 20:33:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use testenv deps instead of repeating the dependencies

The list of dependencies was incomplete in several tox environments.
Instead of replicating it, simply refer to the master testenv dependency
list. Also use white space indenting consistently to be easier on the
eyes.

Change-Id: I80198d773d9cf9fdae72cfc649b533e1d14bb181
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-05-13 21:46:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use testenv deps instead of repeating the dependencies

The list of dependencies was incomplete in several tox environments.
Instead of replicating it, simply refer to the master testenv dependency
list. We can also move linter dependencies into tox.ini directly as
they're blacklisted in global-requirements so cinder can pick the
version on its own, and they don't need to be tracked on
*requirements.txt. This has also the advantage that it doesn't get
unnecessarily pulled into other tox environments.

Also use white space indenting consistently to be easier on the
eyes.

Change-Id: I80198d773d9cf9fdae72cfc649b533e1d14bb181

commit_message:
Use testenv deps instead of repeating the dependencies

The list of dependencies was incomplete in several tox environments.
Instead of replicating it, simply refer to the master testenv dependency
list.

Also use white space indenting consistently to be easier on the
eyes.

Change-Id: I80198d773d9cf9fdae72cfc649b533e1d14bb181

commit_message:
Update virtual media boot-related constants

Constants related to virtual media boot are modified to identify LC and
RAC event messages only, and not the version.

Story: 2008708
Task: 42042

Change-Id: Id8d1584bb07378fc99247ed047a5df2645a7ce72

subject: Dropping lower constraints testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-18 14:10:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I151e1cae71e4fd69db8e995e7464f109041a3990

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I151e1cae71e4fd69db8e995e7464f109041a3990

subject: Update RETRY_COUNT for virtual media boot
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 12:24:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Updated RETRY_COUNT for virtual media boot

StoryBoard story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008709
* Increased RETRY_COUNT to 35 to provide sufficient time
  to complete already running job. This is observed only for
  cross-boot scenarios like UEFI-BIOS and BIOS-UEFI.

Issue is observed on iDRAC firmware version: 4.22.00.00

commit_message:
Update RETRY_COUNT for virtual media boot

Increase RETRY_COUNT to 35 to provide sufficient time to complete
already running iDRAC configuration job. This has been observed when
ironic performs boot mode synchronization, because the node boot mode
is not the same as bare-metal boot mode.

Story: 2008709
Task: 42043

Change-Id: I78c503a65c0c3fdb17773279d87db425926fa275

subject: Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 15:11:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/quota.py'], 'message': "Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
(cherry picked from commit 9ed17cec2d4ce0bd27e37c2877a413f5b302f4cd)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
(cherry picked from commit 9ed17cec2d4ce0bd27e37c2877a413f5b302f4cd)

commit_message:
test integrate with docker-compose

There are serveral reason to do this.

- operators chould re-create the container very easily. just use
  docker-compose up or down
  
- all the container parameters are saved in the disk. operators could
  know waht is the exact parameters used.
  
- This also simplified the ansible logical.

Change-Id: I1f09b6702b26175011bf53acbcbae29c510889f5

commit_message:
[WIP] Added playbooks for snap deployment

Snap is a telemetry-framework that can be used to collect
and publish metrics. This patch adds playbook for its deployment.
This patch also adds template of task manifest from which SNAP tasks are
created.

Change-Id: I32813dd353e96a02c826cfc541a1af4e8d7a91a4
Partially-implements: bp/monitoring
Co-Authored-By: Sayantani Goswami <sayantani.goswami@intel.com>

commit_message:
Remove layout overrides and use tripleo-ci templates instead

As part of [1] and in line with all other tripleo repos lets use
the tripleo-ci templates. The files: and irrelevant-files matches
are moved to tripleo-ci in the depends-on. This leaves only the
undercloud-minion job in the overrides as it isn't covered by the
templates, but updates tags.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/781322

Change-Id: Id8bdcc314f68fb35050254c6c64fd2317c2555de

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6a30ef8373ba30cbc9c9d0d6de1d640dc349d967

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie501d9e209309990a0ec4d7a4be6f306277cb2b4

subject: Fix condition when to create backends
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 07:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix condition when to create backends

Backend creation should happen on the last host in the group, instead
of the first one, since we put LB in MAINT state during deployment, while
other containers are not ready yet. Thus we should be creating backends
at the very end of the deployment, when all containers are set.

Change-Id: I3d5811e059d1b5cb3e87fe7657872e41105c832e
Closes-Bug: #1920964
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix condition when to create backends

Backend creation should happen on the last host in the group, instead
of the first one, since we put LB in MAINT state during deployment, while
other containers are not ready yet. Thus we should be creating backends
at the very end of the deployment, when all containers are set.

Change-Id: I3d5811e059d1b5cb3e87fe7657872e41105c832e
Closes-Bug: #1920964

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 11:20:13.000000000', 'files': ['conf.d/libvirt.yaml.example', 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py'], 'message': "Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
(cherry picked from commit 085f64578f40152273138898a0dc4566d327dc8f)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
(cherry picked from commit 085f64578f40152273138898a0dc4566d327dc8f)

commit_message:
Retry on creating trove network

For pretty weird reason, first request to create a network to the neutron
fails with 500 without reasonable stack trace. Re-running request succeeds.
So we adding retries to the task which resolves metnioned issue.

Change-Id: I5b09dc3bc52d98df756cdc60c5e94cd1e7344e9a

commit_message:
Use Python3 in client side to run Python2 functional tests

This change makes Python2 functional tests use Python 3 client side
to avoid "InterpreterNotFound: python2.7" error with tox in focal.
Server side processes are still launched on Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ie2ac2b6c05d54e5a7798447ce7c120c2422140e4

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Add warning log when restarting docker container

When a storlet application or its dependencies are updated, we first
try restarting storlet daemon, but if it fails then we restart the
whole container, which might cause ungraceful shutdown of the other
storlet daemon in the same container.

This change adds a warning log so that operators can understand how
many times such stop failure have happened in the deployment.

Change-Id: I2843bf1118505a2e32e1f80e7329ed73de1cd62d

commit_message:
backup dependents failure

Incremental backup created fails, its parent_id will record the id of the parent backup, but num_dependent_backup is not increased by 1, resulting in has_dependent_backups being false, but the deletion of the parent backup will fails. This patch adds 1 to the num_dependent_backup of the parent backup when the backup creation fails.

Change-Id: I97afdc561b346abb87c3801aaab4b9f3e7492d6d
Closes-Bug: #1907542

commit_message:
Nova kubernetes changes

* Changed interface to listen to 0.0.0.0
* Allows the user to point at a cluster for the following services that
  isn't defined by the Ansible hostvars:
	* RabbitMQ
	* MemcacheD
	* Neutron
	* Keystone

Change-Id: Iadbdd3aa43f9ba91ec820220fb8828e69161c579
Co-authored-by: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override

subject: Horizon Frontend - (for kolla-kubernetes)
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-24 23:29:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Horizon Frontend - (for kolla-kubernetes)

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch allows for an haproxy based frontend container to be
created that, through kolla config options, allows multiple horizon
backends to be defined, browsers to be temporarily bound to the
versions they initially landed on, and new horizons introduced for
testing and promotion to default.

Two new variables are defined:
 * horizon_versions: an array of versions that are part of the
   system. Defaults to ["1"]
 * horizon_version_default: new browser sessions coming in are
   defaulted to this version. Defaults to "1"

So, for example, with the following config, older existing sessions
will continue to work on version 1 (say, Mitaka based), and all new
connections will go to version 2 (say, Newton based), allowing
version 1 to be gracefully drained and eventually deleted:
  horizon_versions: ["1", "2"]
  horizon_version_default: "2"

It is intended to be used along with corresponding logic in Kolla-Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I2dcd0fc224a959cc36cb7fd2a2adc99be280b7ff

commit_message:
Horizon Frontend - (for kolla-kubernetes)

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch allows for an haproxy based frontend container to be
created that, through kolla config options, allows multiple horizon
backends to be defined, browsers to be temporarily bound to the
versions they initially landed on, and new horizons introduced for
testing and promotion to default.

Two new variables are defined:
 * horizon_versions: an array of versions that are part of the
   system. Defaults to ["1"]
 * horizon_version_default: new browser sessions coming in are
   defaulted to this version. Defaults to "1"

So, for example, with the following config, older existing sessions
will continue to work on version 1 (say, Mitaka based), and all new
connections will go to version 2 (say, Newton based), allowing
version 1 to be gracefully drained and eventually deleted:
  horizon_versions: ["1", "2"]
  horizon_version_default: "2"

It is intended to be used along with corresponding logic in Kolla-Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I2dcd0fc224a959cc36cb7fd2a2adc99be280b7ff

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE!: PoC of ansible override

We can't merge this until we deal with license issues. This strategy
plugin will allow to include custom tasks into ansible playbook without
changing kolla code.

To include file after any task with Aodh in name, put this into
globals.yml

ansible_override:
    include_after:
        task: "Aodh"
        file: "/home/ubuntu/test.yml"

Change-Id: If5f6a6479ebf5b94a2a55dc40d55c2e00f20a5e4

the required contents.

commit_message:
New test, extends test_subport_connectivity

Related-Bug: #1869244

Adding new test, test_subport_connectivity_soft_reboot
The test is checking trunks and ports are recreated during server
reboots, especialy in ovs_dpdk ports,
Since test flow is variant of test_subport_connectivity
Two methods added and used in the tests:
_create_servers_with_trunk_port
_check_servers_remote_connectivity

Change-Id: Ia5fbe680bb904680f52e0e15056d629717a643af

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-29 11:47:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix Docker registry port error in image-building.rst

The default port of Docker registry is 5000. But the 5000 port is also
the port of keystone-api. To avoid conflict, use 4000 port as Docker
registry port.

Change-Id: I3885cdbb3d4e68db2d34e479b2e974286036fdd7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2016-12-29 12:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/image-building.rst'], 'message': 'Fix Docker registry port error in image-building.rst

The default port of Docker registry is 5000. But the 5000 port is also
the port of keystone-api. To avoid conflict, use 4000 port as Docker
registry port.

Change-Id: I3885cdbb3d4e68db2d34e479b2e974286036fdd7
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix Docker registry port error in image-building.rst

The default port of Docker registry is 5000. But the 5000 port is also
the port of keystone-api. To avoid conflict, use 4000 port as Docker
registry port.

commit_message:
Add UEFI deploy file in ironic pxe container

Currently, ironic which deployed by kolla-ansible just support pxe
method to deploy OS, add support for UEFI deploy.

The UEFI support guide is in "PXE UEFI setup" section:
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-pxe.html

Change-Id: I52c4c3a2088b024d2173260910efc93a4ec4b06c

commit_message:
Use 'project' instead of 'tenant'

While switching to openstackclient we use project instead
of tenant.

Change-Id: I93202c371a263f2ed8dace0dc8d3db5c9c8cf16c

commit_message:
Kube OVS DB to listen on tcp:port and neutron-ovs-agent to use script

This PS adds tcp socket to ovsdb process to listen to and it also changes
neutron-openvswitch-agent start command. It will start via script which  now
accepts orchestration specific parameters.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0c5e51fbce7776ba38eb1cca4b040017b0d69351

commit_message:
Add external ceph support for cinder and glance

Modify the conditional strategy for cinder and glance regarding ceph:
use cinder_volume_driver and glance_volume_driver instead of
enable_ceph.

Introduced some config values into globals.yml and passwords.yml to be
able to use the ceph driver without deploying a ceph cluster.

This strategy could be used in other versions.

WARNING: before merging into "stable", please test the non-regression
in the "enable_ceph=yes" situation (deploying a ceph cluster). It
should be compatible but has not been tested.

Co-Authored-By: Mathias Ewald <mewald@evoila.de>
Change-Id: If05eefcf1c91e4d564ec32d12d144f47564162d6
Implements: spec external-ceph
Signed-off-by: Sebastien Fuchs <sebastien@emmene-moi.fr>

2. Change osd partition-related naming rules to easily obtain relevant
disk information

3.Optimize disk results for filestore and bluestore, discard disk
information that is not relevant.

commit_message:
Optimize bluestore deployment in kolla

The following optimizations were made to the bluestore deployment:

1. Change osd partition-related naming rules to easily obtain relevant
disk information
2. In find_disks.py, separate the disk information of ceph and other
components, and optimize disk results for filestore and bluestore,
discard disk information that is not relevant.
3. Direct use of disk partition variables, no additional judgment is
required to determine the disk type.
4. Supports three combinations of partition labels to initialize osd.
5. Solved the problem of block partition computing weight error.
6. Modify the type id of the osd partition to avoid container startup
failure caused by ceph automount.

Change-Id: Ic2cd282eb81368b7361a8012544e0b240102e3f5
Closes-bug: #1776888

commit_message:
WIP - kuryr-ocp job

Do not review yet, it's a starting point to have a single-node job
 that will build kuryr image, push it to a registry and deploy an OCP
 cluster against an OpenStack public cloud using that Kuryr image and
 see the results.

Change-Id: I86735beb07384fceeb02006c35e48c225a4b160e
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 08:09:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Deploy bluestore directly with partition name in kolla

1.In the bluestore initialization code, the device name and the
partition sequence are used to splicing the partition name, but
this causes a certain code redundancy and doesn't support other
devices, such as bcache devices. This patch solves this problem
and uses the partition name directly.
2.Optimized the return information of find_disks.py, only returns
valid disk information, does not return null values.
3.When osd_initial_weight is auto, kolla will calculate the weight
according to the size of the disk, so when using bluestore, it need
to calculate the weight according to the size of the block.

Change-Id: I5b544a966edf5f0814cc14fd964d04c4687045e1

", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2018-11-01 01:28:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support multipath disk for bluestore in kolla

1. Support for bluestore osd deployment on multipath disks.
2. Because the symbolic link of the multipath disk uses the format
of 'typecode.partuuid', in order to maintain consistency, the symbolic
link of the regular disk changes from partlabel to partuuid.
3. There are many types of disk naming suffixes that are 'p+number',
such as the default naming of multipath disks, bcache disks, but the
script currently only supports loop devices, this patch fixes this
problem.
4. Optimized the return information of find_disks.py, only returns
valid disk information, does not return null values.
5. Kolla supports calculating the weight of osd according to the size
of the disk. The current script uses the osd data partition(100M) when
calculating the weight of the bluestore osd. The block partition
should be used. This patch fixes this problem.

Closes-bug: #1741489

Change-Id: I5b544a966edf5f0814cc14fd964d04c4687045e1

commit_message:
Support multipath disk for bluestore in kolla

1. Support for bluestore osd deployment on multipath disks.
2. Because the symbolic link of the multipath disk uses the format
of 'typecode.partuuid', in order to maintain consistency, the symbolic
link of the regular disk changes from partlabel to partuuid.
3. There are many types of disk naming suffixes that are 'p+number',
such as the default naming of multipath disks, bcache disks, but the
script currently only supports loop devices, this patch fixes this
problem.
4. Optimized the return information of find_disks.py, only returns
valid disk information, does not return null values.
5. Kolla supports calculating the weight of osd according to the size
of the disk. The current script uses the osd data partition(100M) when
calculating the weight of the bluestore osd. The block partition
should be used. This patch fixes this problem.

Closes-bug: #1741489

Change-Id: I5b544a966edf5f0814cc14fd964d04c4687045e1

subject: Corrects missing packages from Xen
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 19:34:17.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Corrects missing packages from Xen

Two additional packages are necessary for xen to properly install
on the compute nodes. These packages are python2 and needed only
in the centos binary deployments. Xen is only compatible with that
version of openstack.

Change-Id: Id6ddb5688184b18e6fab11f3252a9083bffda5aa
Closes-bug: #1837767
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Corrects missing packages from Xen

Two additional packages are necessary for xen to properly install
on the compute nodes. These packages are python2 and needed only
in the centos binary deployments. Xen is only compatible with that
version of openstack.

Change-Id: Id6ddb5688184b18e6fab11f3252a9083bffda5aa
Closes-bug: #1837767

commit_message:
Upgrade Haproxy to version 1.8.x

Haproxy in centos 7 repos version is only 1.5.18 [1].
It's quite outdated. Kolla should upgrade Haproxy
package to 1.8.x version for new features.

Use centos software collections repo. Haproxy
version up to 1.8.17. [2]

[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/haproxy-1.5.18-8.el7.x86_64.rpm
[2] https://www.softwarecollections.org/en/scls/rhscl/rh-haproxy18/

commit_message:
split templates to work around configparser bug

Move the percent character to the template from the string to allow
setting either % or %% as needed to work around the bug linked below.
This requires each service 'family' to have two versions of it's config
file.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1872553

Change-Id: I68f276224c51d5682d77123eae697767fadf9b19
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>
(cherry picked from commit 3e151d97adbff78be1b146938374a0dced5970e9)

commit_message:
Adding support of subnet_dns_publish_fixed_ip extension in ml2 plugin

The subnet-dns-publish-fixed-ip extension adds a new attribute to the definition of the subnet resource. When set to true it will allow publishing DNS records for fixed IPs from that subnet independent of the restrictions described in the [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-dns-int-ext-serv.html

Change-Id: I095564cec0f5804e4d0ea9b5201ed40b9d9be603

Closes-Bug: #1921292
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Extend timeout for RPM verification

For systems with many packages deployed or heavy loaded environments
rpm verification takes the way more time then 5 minutes ending up in
corrupted database of the rpm packages. So we set limit to 1 hour
and extending amount of retries to wait for result to match the async
timeout

Change-Id: I30d29630214914bea99fc7fd66afa3218705d733
Closes-Bug: #1921292

This commit makes the delete_router_port() method from OVNClient more
resilient to NotFound errors. Apart from the L3 plugin, this method is
also invoked by the maintenance task to fix stale/not-up-to-date objects
in the OVN database, and since the maintenance task runs every 5 minutes
only it could happen that some objects fetched by delete_router_port()
are gone by the moment that method is invoked.

Closes-Bug: #1920968
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Make delete_router_port() less error prone

This commit makes the delete_router_port() method from OVNClient more
resilient to NotFound errors. Apart from the L3 plugin, this method is
also invoked by the maintenance task to fix stale/not-up-to-date objects
in the OVN database, and since the maintenance task runs every 5 minutes
only it could happen that some objects fetched by delete_router_port()
are gone by the moment that method is invoked.

Change-Id: I0d78278797beb2af42ec38462e2b2edc8e2a4ae6
Closes-Bug: #1920968
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Process subordinate releases packages map

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This change will allow a subordinate charm that have opted into the
feature to inform its principal about all implemented release -
packages combinations ahead of time. With this information in place
the principal can do the upgrade in one operation without risk of
charm relation RPC type processing at a critical moment.

Also sync c-h.

Closes-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: I95567d5d047eb64842436e671b74a633e6f509f4

subject: Bump the Compute RPC API to version 6.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 09:56:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_live_migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'message': "Bump the Compute RPC API to version 6.0

Even if we want to bump the compute rpc api to a new major version, we still
need to support 5.x for the rolling upgrade case.

Adding a proxy that will handle those old RPC calls/casts so we could easily
cut it in a later change in the next X release timeframe (as we won't longer
support Victoria 5.x calls)

On the client side, we're making sure that we can still support v5.x methods
until the next X release (as operators could pin on 5.0 version for Victoria

NOTE(sbauza): Now that the compute service only supports the 6.0
version, we could remove all the unnecessary verifications in both the
manager but also the functional and unittests. That being said, given
the patch would be large, I think it's better to just amend the needed
modifications for supporting 6.0 and delete the above in later changes.
For example, the NUMA live migration functests verify a lot of RPC API
compatibilities in between 5.2, 5.3 and later. We need to stop verifying
this but let's do this in later changes, please.

Change-Id: I4529b4b36b390935ac0227d94db398d65ae11ce0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bump the Compute RPC API to version 6.0

Even if we want to bump the compute rpc api to a new major version, we still
need to support 5.x for the rolling upgrade case.

Adding a proxy that will handle those old RPC calls/casts so we could easily
cut it in a later change in the next X release timeframe (as we won't longer
support Victoria 5.x calls)

On the client side, we're making sure that we can still support v5.x methods
until the next X release (as operators could pin on 5.0 version for Victoria
compute nodes)

NOTE(sbauza): Now that the compute service only supports the 6.0
version, we could remove all the unnecessary verifications in both the
manager but also the functional and unittests. That being said, given
the patch would be large, I think it's better to just amend the needed
modifications for supporting 6.0 and delete the above in later changes.
For example, the NUMA live migration functests verify a lot of RPC API
compatibilities in between 5.2, 5.3 and later. We need to stop verifying
this but let's do this in later changes, please.

Change-Id: I4529b4b36b390935ac0227d94db398d65ae11ce0

commit_message:
split templates to work around configparser bug

Move the percent character to the template from the string to allow
setting either % or %% as needed to work around the bug linked below.
This requires each service 'family' to have two versions of it's config
file.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1872553

Change-Id: I68f276224c51d5682d77123eae697767fadf9b19
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 09:06:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1e263e22dac088dd8d1422ea7ddca6b64b3c92f9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1e263e22dac088dd8d1422ea7ddca6b64b3c92f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 18:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent'], 'message': "Create $OVS_SYSCONFDIR if it doesn't exist

Looks like I8e3b05f3ab83e204bc1ce895baec0e1ba515895b broke
kuryr-kubernetes OVN gates because /etc/openvswitch does not exist
there. This commit makes sure the directory exists before we try tee-ing
there.

Change-Id: I8615c5d2cc6811fe5e6c910351feb092f37f379a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Create $OVS_SYSCONFDIR if it doesn't exist

Looks like I8e3b05f3ab83e204bc1ce895baec0e1ba515895b broke
kuryr-kubernetes OVN gates because /etc/openvswitch does not exist
there. This commit makes sure the directory exists before we try tee-ing
there.

Change-Id: I8615c5d2cc6811fe5e6c910351feb092f37f379a

commit_message:
Set default OVS_SYSCONFDIR value depending on OVS_PREFIX

When OVN is built from source, the value of OVS_PREFIX is set to
"/usr/local". All other paths referring to OVS should be prefixed
with this value.

Closes-Bug: #1920634
Related-Bug: #1918656

Change-Id: I9a45a5379d1c47cdf67b9c6d3d0409a88501e61e

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 18:59:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add anaconda support in the pxe boot driver

To prepare for booting anaconda we need to generate a kickstart file
from the kickstart template and pass it to the installer as a kernel
command line argument (inst.ks). Similarly the second stage of the
installer (stage2) needs to fetched and it's location needs to be
passed as a kernel command line argument (inst.stage2)

This change also adds 'boot_anaconda' target to pxe_config.template
and ipxe_config.template and renders that target correctly. The pxe
configuration will automatically switch to boot_anaconda target when
the boot_option is 'kickstart'.

Change-Id: I3ffe5a60684cdefe51c7a0a47acc1acedbb49145

configuration will automatically switch to boot_anaconda target when
the boot_option is 'kickstart'.

commit_message:
Add anaconda support in the pxe boot driver

To prepare for booting anaconda we need to generate a kickstart file
from the kickstart template and pass it to the installer as a kernel
command line argument (inst.ks). Similarly the second stage of the
installer (stage2) needs to fetched and it's location needs to be
passed as a kernel command line argument (inst.stage2)

This change also adds 'boot_anaconda' target to pxe_config.template
and ipxe_config.template and renders that target correctly. The pxe
configuration will automatically switch to boot_anaconda target when
the boot_option is 'kickstart'.

Change-Id: I3ffe5a60684cdefe51c7a0a47acc1acedbb49145

Proposing Wallaby RC1 for sahara-extra

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 12.0.0..cf57628

commit_message:
Standardize topics to use during series

These changes aim to standardize the gerrit topic to use with on our patches.

This:
- will allow us to better retrieve the history from previous series;
- could allow us to generate some statistic and monitoring from series
  to series to allow us to get a better big picture of things are.

I already defined this point the potential process/tools changes for Xena.

https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/xena-ptg-os-relmgt

Maintenance mode is becoming more and more prominent, a little standardization
can't hurt.

Change-Id: Ib7ea93fce7e618a2dbba8dd9f4153897bdfee22a

commit_message:
fix unmange share with manage_error status will lead to quota error

if we failed to manage a share, we don't need to commit the quota usages. so
we should skip quota usages cuts when delete or unmange the share with
status of "error_manage". and the size of error_manage share should be
zero.

Closes-Bug:#1883506

Change-Id: I5c81dd6780890c55c8c6a92491c3f4f507531fdb

commit_message:
Improve guest agent when start

If we run guest agent, sometime it can't connect to database because
root user was secure with password make can't right work.

I hope this path will improve it by get password of root user to
authenticate with database

Task: #42105
Story: #2008746
Change-Id: I666120fc9df8d1c0bea72dee95763c2462e256ca

commit_message:
Set toplevel nova::dhcp_domain for all nova services

Setting nova::metadata::dhcp_domain will no longer work unless nova::metadata
is included.
Since I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c we no longer include
nova::metadata on computes.
So we must now set nova::dhcp_domain in nova-base instead of relying on the
deprecated nova::metadata::dhcp_domain param.

Conflicts:
  deployment/nova/nova-base-puppet.yaml

Closes-bug: #1905418
Depends-on: I98fe83e0c245388944529cd19b5e2bbed134e855
Change-Id: Iaf7823ea8d456008c1f4a3d7631657faa65eb6d3
(cherry picked from commit bf7ef6b4d7c05e2c6a71138f68ba970f6604f743)

commit_message:
[Arm64][libvirt] Fix read bytes from json files

This fix issue that we might get str stream from json files instead of bytes
and make sure we read bytes from json files under
QEMU_FIRMWARE_DESCRIPTOR_PATHS.

Add `rb` mode ([1]) to return contents as bytes objects.
[1] https://docs.python.org/3.8/library/functions.html#open

Closes-Bug: #1921075

Change-Id: I446be58f7f3e972d8e10cc5cbf83ebd42edb34e3

commit_message:
ETSI-NFV SOL 001 translation: AffinityRule

The current heat-translator supports several conversions of
resources defined in ETSI NFV-SOL 001[1].
This patch supports the conversion of new resource types.
Specifically, the following types related to
'PlacementConstraints'.
- tosca.groups.nfv.PlacementGroup
- tosca.policies.nfv.AffinityRule
- tosca.policies.nfv.AntiAffinityRule

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/001/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL001v020601p.pdf

Co-Authored-By: Hiroo Kitamura hiroo.kitamura@ntt-at.co.jp
Implements: blueprint support-placement-constraints
Change-Id: Ic22a6183ee0d7c8357063bdafbb1a11c1a6efa3c

commit_message:
Fix processing related to required properties

In the current UT testcase and yaml, there are several cases where
the required property of policy is insufficient or the definition
part is incorrect.
In addition, there is a bug in the code that has the translation
logic under 'translator/hot/tosca/'.
This patch fixes these translation logic codes, testcase and yaml.

Among the fixed yaml files, the following has a line feed code of CRLF,
so it has been modified to LF.

* translator/tests/data/autoscaling/tosca_cluster_autoscaling.yaml
* translator/tests/data/custom_types/senlin_cluster_policies.yaml
* translator/tests/data/nfv/test_tosca_nfv_autoscaling_with_params.yaml

In addition, NOTE description is added for
'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_policies_monitoring.py',
which is one of the translation logic codes.

Closes-Bug: #1918360
Change-Id: Ib9dec61007db5d354eaca86000ab3bcf6744a838

commit_message:
Prevent python2 installation

The python-requests package requires python2 to be installed, when
python3 only is basically needed. It will exclude CVEs related to python2.
Futhermore, it will decrease the image size.

Change-Id: I8ed6fe1c5e8cb7d49ae72763716ee480198bfe20

commit_message:
Make baremetal --debug actually work

The --debug option exists but does nothing. Wire in openstacksdk logging
and make sure ironicclient can log as well.

Change-Id: I136503f546be2ecbd3203ee07597df59a40a594e

commit_message:
Sample script for deploying Kubernetes cluster

This patch implements spec
Support deploying Kubernetes cluster with MgmtDriver
in blueprint bp/cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs.

It includes sample mgmt_driver scripts of deploying
kubernetes cluster to vm created by openstack_driver.
Support instantiate/terminate/scale/heal function.

It also includes a shell script that actual install
kubernets cluster on vm, and an use guide to show
how to use this sample script.

Implements: bp/cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs
Change-Id: I4d0085ffa3b4c90741ebb169b96f69113e2bb6d7

after scale_out, tacker is getting stack_id from heat_client,
however in heat, stack_id seems not in metadata.

in instantiate, the logic is different which updates stack_id
from vnfc_res_info in tacker.

This patch fixes this bug by replace stack_id getting logic
of scale out to logic in instantiate.

After scale_out, tacker is getting stack_id from heat_client.
However stack_id is not in heat.metadata.
This will cause other lcm operations to this vnf_instance
fail(like heal)

For vnf_instances creted by instantiate interface,
this problem does not happen because after instantiate,
tacker will get stack_id from vnfc_res_info, not asking
heat.

This patch fixes this bug by change get stack_id logic after
scale_out by getting physical_resource_id from
target Heat AutoScalingGroup resource(vnfc_res_info)

Change-Id: I12fe98e51930c48da8540368c6b38f8254b0b68b

commit_message:
Fix bug cannot get stack_id for scale_out vnf

After scale_out, tacker is getting stack_id from heat_client.
However stack_id is not in heat.metadata.
This will cause other lcm operations to this vnf_instance
fail(like heal)

For vnf_instances creted by instantiate interface,
this problem does not happen because after instantiate,
tacker will get stack_id from vnfc_res_info, not asking
heat.

This patch fixes this bug by change get stack_id logic after
scale_out by getting physical_resource_id from
target Heat AutoScalingGroup resource(vnfc_res_info)

Closes-Bug: #1919434
Change-Id: I12fe98e51930c48da8540368c6b38f8254b0b68b

resulting image.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 14:14:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support CNF heal operations based on ETSI NFV

Implements Container based VNF heal operation support with ETSI
NFV-SOL002 and SOL003 v2.6.1 VNF Lifecycle Management. For "Heal VNFC
with SOL002", users can heal Pod (mapped as VNFC) that is singleton or
created using controller resources such as Kubernetes Deployment,
DaemonSet, StatefulSet and ReplicaSet. For "Heal VNF instance with
SOL003", users can heal entire VNF instance by termination and
instantiation of the VNF.

Other changes:
* Store Pod information to vnfcResourceInfo after instantiation.
* Update vnfcResourceInfo after scale operation.

Implements: blueprint support-cnf-heal
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-cnf-heal.html
Change-Id: I62bf8d67eb9b3889f2ae69be9bb45363d083f48e

commit_message:
Support CNF heal operations based on ETSI NFV

Implements Container based VNF heal operation support with ETSI
NFV-SOL002 and SOL003 v2.6.1 VNF Lifecycle Management. For "Heal VNFC
with SOL002", users can heal Pod (mapped as VNFC) that is singleton or
created using controller resources such as Kubernetes Deployment,
DaemonSet, StatefulSet and ReplicaSet. For "Heal VNF instance with
SOL003", users can heal entire VNF instance by termination and
instantiation of the VNF.

Other changes:
* Store Pod information to vnfcResourceInfo after instantiation.
* Update vnfcResourceInfo after scale operation.

Implements: blueprint support-cnf-heal
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-cnf-heal.html
Change-Id: I62bf8d67eb9b3889f2ae69be9bb45363d083f48e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 02:45:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix a regex of naming rule for a Pod of a Deployment

This patch is fix a regex of naming rule for a Pod of a Deployment.

The naming rule of Pod in deployment is
"(deployment name)-(pod template hash)-(5 charactors)".

Currently, "pod template hash" is a regex with a fixed 10 characters.
However, it may be less than 10 characters, this case is fail in
"scale_wait" of CNF scale.

The "pod template hash" string is generated from 32 bit hash. This
may be from 1 to 10 caracters but not sure the lower limit from the
source code of Kubernetes. Temporarily, this is set to be "{1,10}"
but may need to be fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1921059
Change-Id: I49f6cbe032f35f435f6c9ee69ccb8596cccdb326

commit_message:
Fix a regex of naming rule for a Pod of a Deployment

This patch is fix a regex of naming rule for a Pod of a Deployment.

The naming rule of Pod in deployment is
"(deployment name)-(pod template hash)-(5 charactors)".

Currently, "pod template hash" is a regex with a fixed 10 characters.
However, it may be less than 10 characters, this case is fail in
"scale_wait" of CNF scale.

The "pod template hash" string is generated from 32 bit hash. This
may be from 1 to 10 caracters but not sure the lower limit from the
source code of Kubernetes. Temporarily, this is set to be "{1,10}"
but may need to be fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1921059
Change-Id: I49f6cbe032f35f435f6c9ee69ccb8596cccdb326

commit_message:
Rename ContainerBroker.path to cpath

It might actually even better to call this weird contraption
"_path", just to underscore (please pardon the pun) that it is
a weird synthetic construct, unique to the containers. It's not
a file path or any other conventional path.

But at least let's make it easier to filter it out from the
grep results.

commit_message:
Switch neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode to be non voting temporary

This job is very unstable due to related bug. As we are just before
releasing new stable release, lets unblock our gate for now quickly by
making it non-voting and removing it from the gate queue temporary.

Change-Id: I971be39b50d521ea51090633ba465116a2118506
Related-Bug: #1920778

commit_message:
relinker: Add policy to relinker progress output

The partition progress logging line currently includes device, step and
the progress of partitions. But if your running a part-power increase on
more then one policy at a time, then we're missing a crucial piece of
information, the policy.

This patch add the policy to the log line too:

  Step: cleanup Device: sda1 Policy: <policy name> Partitions: 1/2

Change-Id: I1dd3362b0a35592867ddaaa86dfa9d95e241373a

testing but using the functional testing framework, that provides
SQL opportunistic testing drivers for MySQL and PostgreSQL backends.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Test SQL cast in "get_total_reservations_map"

This patch implements the tests for [1]. Instead of using the usual
OVO SQL unit test, based in SQLite, this patch implements a similar
testing but using the functional testing framework, that provides
SQL opportunistic testing drivers for MySQL and PostgreSQL backends.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/779878

Related-Bug: #1918565

Change-Id: I9284a6830ea103cb51a775fff720973852076770
(cherry picked from commit 60b08896ab596be272e83c97be80ad62a3e2cbe4)

commit_message:
Use quay.ceph.io to pull the Ceph Dashboard related images

The purpose of this change is just to switch to quay.ceph.io
and pull from that location the Ceph Dashboard related images.
quay.ceph.io is maintained by the Ceph organization and can
be trusted to find the tags that we need.

Closes-Bug: #1920873
Change-Id: If5ec5d4fa0d4d835561b5963d244e5172fe82cc8

commit_message:
Add support for py39

- Use version agnostic "py" inside tox default envs
- Enable py39 testing jobs (new template contains them)
- Address deprecation warning in setup.cfg regarding use of dashes
  instead of underlines (avoid future breakage with setuptools)

Change-Id: I26be50e029393e01db6718a21ac67d669ccd2e0c

commit_message:
Add files: and irrelevant-files: from tripleo-ansible layout

As part of [1] this moves the files: and irrelevant-files: from
tripleo-ansible. The templates are wired up instead at [2] which
depends-on this patch.

The depends-on here is not relevant to the patch but required to
get the victoria content-provider to pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce
[2] Id8bdcc314f68fb35050254c6c64fd2317c2555de

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/782367

Change-Id: Ia82e796007be3155a1161a8a6a49ea35502a2408

commit_message:
Adds explicit error message

When a user sets a quota that is greater than 2147483647, an
exlicit error message that "Quota limit should not exceed 2147483647"
is communicated. This is better with regard to the initial message
which was "ERROR: The server has either erred or is
incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500)."

Closes-Bug: #1908352
Change-Id: I6e1211cde7cd39838a0be4ff15e36471992c492f

When a user sets a quota that is greater than 2147483647, an
exlicit error message that "Quota limit should not exceed 2147483647"
is communicated. This is better with regard to the initial message
which was "ERROR: The server has either erred or is
incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500)."

subject: Make ShardRange.OuterBound a proper singleton
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 14:16:06.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Make ShardRange.OuterBound a proper singleton

ShardRange.OuterBound had the singleton-like property of all instances
of the same class being equal, but did not prevent multiple instances
being created.  Instead, ShardRange.MIN and ShardRange.MAX are used to
hold single instances of each outer bound.

The ShardRange.OuterBound equality property was achieved by overriding
the default __eq__ method, but as a consequence the type was not
hashable, preventing it being used in lists or as a dict key without
also overriding the default __hash__ method.

This patch makes ShardRangeOuterBound a proper singleton, removing the
need to override __eq__ or __hash__.

Change-Id: I21292e7991e93834b35cda6f5daea4c552a8e999
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make ShardRange.OuterBound a proper singleton

ShardRange.OuterBound had the singleton-like property of all instances
of the same class being equal, but did not prevent multiple instances
being created.  Instead, ShardRange.MIN and ShardRange.MAX are used to
hold single instances of each outer bound.

The ShardRange.OuterBound equality property was achieved by overriding
the default __eq__ method, but as a consequence the type was not
hashable, preventing it being used in lists or as a dict key without
also overriding the default __hash__ method.

This patch makes ShardRangeOuterBound a proper singleton, removing the
need to override __eq__ or __hash__.

Change-Id: I21292e7991e93834b35cda6f5daea4c552a8e999

", 'number': 15}, {'created': '2021-03-16 00:06:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update cephfs drivers to use ceph-mgr client

Use python rados client to talk to the ceph-mgr service.

A python rados client is created by the driver that lasts
during the driver's lifecycle.

The drivers can now work with multiple filesystem clusters.
The filesystem to be used by manila can be specified by the
driver option 'cephfs_filesystem_name'.

The removal of a share will be quicker for the manila user.
The ceph-mgr volumes module moves the share's content to
a trash folder and purges the trash's contents
(`rm -rf` of the backend CephFS subvolume/subtree) aysnchronously,
whereas the ceph_volume_client library moves the share's content
and purges the content synchronously.

Implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

Change-Id: I1f81db1ba7724c0784d87f9cb92bb696f6778806

", 'number': 18}, {'created': '2021-03-16 21:50:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update cephfs drivers to use ceph-mgr client

Use python rados client to talk to the ceph-mgr service.

A python rados client is created by the driver that lasts
during the driver's lifecycle.

The drivers can now work with multiple filesystem clusters.
The filesystem to be used by manila can be specified by the
driver option 'cephfs_filesystem_name'.

The removal of a share will be quicker for the manila user.
The ceph-mgr volumes module moves the share's content to
a trash folder and purges the trash's contents
(`rm -rf` of the backend CephFS subvolume/subtree) aysnchronously,
whereas the ceph_volume_client library moves the share's content
and purges the content synchronously.

Implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

commit_message:
Update cephfs drivers to use ceph-mgr client

Use python rados client to talk to the ceph-mgr service.

A python rados client is created by the driver that lasts
during the driver's lifecycle.

The drivers can now work with multiple filesystem clusters.
The filesystem to be used by manila can be specified by the
driver option 'cephfs_filesystem_name'.

The removal of a share will be quicker for the manila user.
The ceph-mgr volumes module moves the share's content to
a trash folder and purges the trash's contents
(`rm -rf` of the backend CephFS subvolume/subtree) aysnchronously,
whereas the ceph_volume_client library moves the share's content
and purges the content synchronously.

Implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1f81db1ba7724c0784d87f9cb92bb696f6778806

subject: Fix using subnets with host_routes in amphorav2 driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-22 15:32:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix using subnets with host_routes in amphorav2 driver

When using subnets with host_routes in amphorav2, the host_routes
attribute in the Subnet data structure was not correctly converted to a
HostRoute data structure. It triggered exceptions and failed to
provision the load balancer.

commit_message:
Fix using subnets with host_routes in amphorav2 driver

When using subnets with host_routes in amphorav2, the host_routes
attribute in the Subnet data structure was not correctly converted to a
HostRoute data structure. It triggered exceptions and failed to
provision the load balancer.

Story 2008738
Task 42092

Change-Id: I39391070cea170a6039f901093f09fc89ba06123

commit_message:
Adds explicit error message

When a user sets a quota that is greater than 2147483647, an
exlicit error message that "Quota limit should not exceed 2147483647"
is communicated. This is better with regard to the initial message
which was "ERROR: The server has either erred or is
incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500)."

Closes-Bug: #1908352
Change-Id: I6ff3091a82b5560c72a0266768307e40380d220d
